intro: Xylopia longifolia, commonly known as the longifoliate xylopia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Annonaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries such as Kenya, Tanzania, and Uganda. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, woody stems and compound leaves with lanceolate leaflets. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically greenish-white in color, and it produces dark, fleshy berries as fruit. Xylopia longifolia is often found in moist, shaded habitats within lowland forests.
